node.title: MOOSE Instation
node.bodyText:
I have started to install MOOSE following the procedure.
Now I am at
"Upon restarting your terminal, you should see your prompt prefixed with (base). This indicates you are in the base environment, and Conda is ready for operation: $ (base) ~>"
But my terminal does not show "$ (base) >" . It shows just " %"
Please let me know if I can continue installation.
S. Thomas

Hello
What do you get from mamba activate moose ?
then mamba list | grep moose
Guillaume

I did
"mamba init
exit"
as the procedure instructs.
I think "mamba activate moose" is the later process.
I am sill in the process in the Conda MOOSE Environment.
I am just wondering it is OK to proceed with "~%" not the "$(base" prompt.
Please let me know.
S. Thomas
mamba activate moose will not break anything
you could mamba activate base instead

So, type "mamba activate moose" now?
Please let me know.

mamba activate base
mamba list
what do you get

Is it OK to type "mamba init" again?
or it might conflict with some thing.

when type "mamba active base"
I got
"zsh: command not found: mamba"
Is it OK to type "mamba init" again?
or it might conflict with some thing.

Is it OK to re-start from the beginning again?
or it might conflict with some thing.
Please let me know.
it s ok but it s not finding mamba so a step before that one failed

I did
export PATH=$HOME/mambaforge3/bin:$PATH
mamba init
The terminal shows:
"==> For changes to take effect, close and re-open your current shell. <==
Added mamba to /Users/d3k768/.bash_profile
==> For changes to take effect, close and re-open your current shell. <=="
Then, exit and re-start the terminal.  "mamba" does not work any more.
I am just wondering if I can keep moving to the next process of
"conda config --add channels https://conda.software.inl.gov/public" with the "~%" prompt in the terminal.
please let me know.

Hello @styyokuda, So I'm facing the same problem with conda installation in a brand new MacBook Pro with M2 Pro chip. I've already tried all the steps above like creating a .zshrc file but couldn't reach "(base)xxxx@xxx" step. So how did you actually overcame this problem? Thanks in advance.

Same issue as in not being able to get a (base) environment after install?
If I'm reading you correctly, I've run into the same issue with new laptops issues by our organization which "profiles" our machines. Perhaps the same issue exists for you; this is just a guess:
❯ echo $0
-zsh
While this may say ZSH is my shell, somewhere/somehow, the Conda installer detects you might still be using BASH. This is even after running the hint command supplied by Apple when starting in a BASH shell:
The default interactive shell is now zsh.
To update your account to use zsh, please run `chsh -s /bin/zsh`.
For more details, please visit https://support.apple.com/kb/HT208050.
Following the above directions does not seem to fix the issue. Unless you also make the correct modifications to your ~/.zshrc file manually, or, by heading into "System Settings", "Users & Groups", and making the "default shell" modification there (involves right-click advanced options clickery, which I no longer have access to on my corporate managed machine).
If you are unable to make the necessary changes using my "System Settings" instructions, then you are left with creating the necessary ~/.zshrc changes manually.
# >>> conda initialize >>>
# !! Contents within this block are managed by 'conda init' !!
__conda_setup="$('/Users/d3k768/mambaforge3/bin/conda' 'shell.zsh' 'hook' 2> /dev/null)"
                         ^^^^^ this                           ^^^ and this
if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then
    eval "$__conda_setup"
else
    if [ -f "/Users/d3k768/mambaforge3/etc/profile.d/conda.sh" ]; then
        . "/Users/d3k768/mambaforge3/etc/profile.d/conda.sh"
    else
        export PATH="/Users/d3k768/mambaforge3/bin:$PATH"
    fi
fi
unset __conda_setup

if [ -f "/Users/d3k768/mambaforge3/etc/profile.d/mamba.sh" ]; then
    . "/Users/d3k768/mambaforge3/etc/profile.d/mamba.sh"
fi
# <<< conda initialize <<<
Where this, and this need to change accordingly, throughout the file.
If the above has no effect, try copy/pasting the initialization contents into a new file and sourcing it:
cat'ing the file as an example:
❯  cat mamba_init
# >>> conda initialize >>>
# !! Contents within this block are managed by 'conda init' !!
__conda_setup="$('/Users/YOURUSERNAME/mambaforge3/bin/conda' 'shell.zsh' 'hook' 2> /dev/null)"
if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then
    eval "$__conda_setup"
else
    if [ -f "/Users/YOURUSERNAME/mambaforge3/etc/profile.d/conda.sh" ]; then
        . "/Users/YOURUSERNAME/mambaforge3/etc/profile.d/conda.sh"
    else
        export PATH="/Users/YOURUSERNAME/mambaforge3/bin:$PATH"
    fi
fi
unset __conda_setup

if [ -f "/Users/YOURUSERNAME/mambaforge3/etc/profile.d/mamba.sh" ]; then
    . "/Users/YOURUSERNAME/mambaforge3/etc/profile.d/mamba.sh"
fi
# <<< conda initialize <<<
And then source the file manually, see what happens:
❯  source mamba_init
(base)  ❯

Thank you so much @milljm for your elaborate reply. I think that creating the necessary ~/.zshrc manually is the best option. However, I solved it with a different way. Yesterday before getting your response, I installed Conda with mambaforge installer from GitHub rather than following mambaforge3 installation instruction from INL getting started page. I let the installer initialise conda and it created the necessary .zshrc file for me. After that I could install MOOSE smoothly and even ran the step01 of DarcyThermoMech tutorial. Now the question is, am I going to face any problem in the future for using mambaforge instead of mambaforge3? Thanks again for all your help.

Do you recall the URL you installed? Our instructions point to the Miniforge GitHub page. But that site has several variants. Perhaps the one you choose may be the "better" one. I'd like to try it out  for myself, and possibly change our instructions if it "just works better"!

Yes! I do remember. I went to the following URL directly from google.
https://github.com/conda-forge/miniforge#mambaforge
and then I downloaded the installer for the apple silicon chip (Screenshot attached). Thank you.
Well, odd... That is the "group" we are instructing folks to download using curl, so I am not sure why the second attempt worked for you... But I am glad you got it sorted!

Thanks a lot. Strange!... but I can think of a possibility. Before trying for 2nd time I tried creating a .zshrc file and pasting your code manually as per your direction present in these comments. However, it didn't work that time. So, I think the installer got a .zshrc file to manipulate for the 2nd time which wasn't simply present during 1st attempt. I'm not sure myself as I'm shooting in the dark here. However, this is the only difference between my 1st and 2nd attempt. Also, if I remember correctly, the cURL command did not initialise conda automatically. But during 2nd time the installer gave me a prompt in the terminal, something like this:
do you want the installer to initialise conda?(Y/n):
I think that made the difference.

node.title: SecondPhase
node.bodyText:
Request help
The collision program will end after the interaction force between the second phase particles at the solid-liquid interface.
Looking forward to your reply, thank you！

Hello
Could you please give more details? What models are you using?
Guillaume

node.title: changing non-linear tolerance during simulation
node.bodyText:
Hi,
Hope you are doing well.
I wanted to know that if we can change the non-linear tolerance during the simulation. In my system, I add an extra phase to simulation which add to non-linearity of system and I was wondering if this is possible. The alternative way would be restart/recover method with a more loose tolerance, I guess. Thanks.

Hello
No we currently cant change that number. It's set in the input file and we can't modify it
Guillaume

node.title: [Geochemistry Module] Kinetic Rate as an aux-variable
node.bodyText:
Hello Moose Geochemistry Experts,
Is it possible to output the dissolution rate calculated by the GeochemistryKineticRate UO as an aux-variable? For example, let’s say I want to output the kinetically-controlled dissolution rate of quartz and then use this rate as a coupled variable in a PorousFlow material. Is this feasible, and how do I go about it? Thx.
@WilkAndy?

node.title: Varibale derivates, coupled variable derivatives
node.bodyText:
I have general questions about how to add variable derivatives to the kernel. My specific questions are:


How can I add different variable derivatives (let it be WRT time, space, or a mix of these two) to the kernel. Is there any source or sample that I can refer to?!
Let's say I want to use _ad_grad_u_dot in my kernel. How should the header and the source files look like?


How can I do the same for coupled variables and their derivatives?


Thank you,
Alireza

Hello
You have to leverage the coupleable (interfaces/coupleable.h) interface to retrieve those derivatives (time -> coupledDot, space -> coupledGradient)
In your header for the kernel you are creating, add references to those values. The type of the values is the return type of the routine in the coupleable interface.
Guillaume

Hi Guillaume,
Thank you so much for your response. I'm still struggling with this. Could you please provide some sample header and source files in which they use higher order dedrivatives like ad_grad_u_dot or the second order derivative WRT time and space of the field variables?
It would be great if you can refer me to some sample header and source files that do the same for coupled variables as well.
I appreciate your help,
Alireza

Here's one with a u_dot
https://github.com/idaholab/moose/blob/968eb46a3868f624d7930083ffdedd039b3d4fd5/framework/include/kernels/TimeKernel.h
Here s on with a grad_u
https://github.com/idaholab/moose/blob/968eb46a3868f624d7930083ffdedd039b3d4fd5/framework/include/auxkernels/DiffusionFluxAux.h
Second time derivative of a VECTOR (remove vector to get a scalar)

  
    
      moose/modules/electromagnetics/include/kernels/VectorSecondTimeDerivative.h
    
    
         Line 30
      in
      968eb46
    
  
  
    

        
          
           const VectorVariableValue & _u_dot_dot; 
        
    
  


in general you want to rely on this page to use the coupleable interface:
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/docs/doxygen/moose/classCoupleable.html

node.title: Nodal Materials
node.bodyText:
Can Functor materials be used as nodal materials? Otherwise are there any plans to implement nodal materials for use with the nodal kernel system?
For context I'm currently trying to develop a reaction-diffusion type app with a large number of species, where the reaction rates at each point are calculated in an external library I'd like to treat as a black-box. I think I'd like to use nodal kernels and the AD system for this, but an initial implementation using a user object and aux-variables (similar to Thermochimica in the chemical reaction module) hasn't worked for me. I did manage to get something running with normal kernels and materials, but I'm concerned numerical stability could be an issue.
Thanks for your time.

Hello
Not currently.
However, this is something we are considering because it would be very natural.
A new NodalArg for the functor spatial argument could be {node, element}  or {node, subdomain_id} and would naturally know which subdomain the material has been defined on.
Part of the problem with nodal materials has always been how to deal with different material definitions on different subdomains, as nodes can be at the interface between two subdomains. I think this is solved if we let the caller specify which subdomain the node is actually part of.
@lindsayad  will know more about issues with nodal materials
Guillaume

Hi @stephen-dixon thank you for your interest in functors 😄 Yes I think nodal functor evaluation could be on the way soon. See #19420 where adding nodal evaluations is a top priority. I agree with @GiudGiud that supplying a subdomain would alleviate the principal concern we've always had with "nodal materials", e.g. what happens at the intersection between multiple different materials. But by allowing the user to explicitly say what subdomain they want to associate with, that concern goes away
"Functors are great and we want more of them" love it. Thanks for the quick responses.

node.title: Can a parse function material property depend on the old value of a variable?
node.bodyText: Hi, i want to create a material property depending on the last time step value of a variable in a parse function manner. Can you guys give some advice?

Hello
You can use the coupledValueOld instead of the coupledValue to get the variable value at the last time step.
However, with ParsedMaterial, we have not implemented that.
So you would have to either:

modify the code
use a trick. Using the SelfAux auxkernel you can copy a variable onto another variable. If you execute it on TIMESTEP_BEGIN, you will effectively "save" the previous step variable value

Guillaume

Thanks for your repley. I found that ParsedMaterial and DerivativeParsedMaterial has a parameter "material_property_names". If I define a material property calculated on some variable old value. And  define a ParsedMaterial depend on the material property.  Then I guess I can obtain a ParsedMaterial depend on the variable old value?
you could do that

node.title: double Integrate Postprocessor
node.bodyText:
Hello Moose Experts.
I found a postprocessor called SideIntegralVariablePostprocessor that integrates variable u over the side.
In a 2D system, it calculates, at the bottom,

I want to calculate

Is there any postprocessor that calculates the above one?
Thank you.
Best wishes,
Jeonghwan

Hello
What are you trying to compute? This does not seem right, a "side" of a 2D system is 1D so the differential element is dx not dx*dx.
Are you looking for a volumetric (2d element in 2D) integration?
To your question, no there is not. But you could make your own by modifying the SideIntegralPostprocessor which has the quadrature integration calculation
GUillaume

I still dont think you need to do this.
The _coord in RZ is here to multiply by the radius
JxW has the local weight of the quadrature and the mapping between elements
Are you performing RZ simulations or 3D with a cylinder system?

No. I am performing a 2D simulation (x,y).
The red box is my system.

And this is my Exodus output results of J which is the current density.

I am performing 2D simulation but if I assume this has cylindrical symmetry, I can consider this as a 3D cylinder system by just doing 2D simulation.
As I mentioned, I want to calculate the current(A) from the current density(A/m^2).
Even if I am doing a 2D simulation for computational efficiency, I want to get the current value in a 3D system with simple and reasonable assumptions.
To do that, I want to calculate (in this case, u is the current density)

this one because, if it is right, I can get the current value by multiplying 3.14.
For example,

If the J is the same over the boundary just like the above simple example, I can just use SideaveragePostprocessor and multiply using Parsedpostprocessor.
Unfortunately, it isn't so that I cannot compare with current values from different systems.
So, does your answer mean that my modification of the code is correct?
Thank you.

Are you using coord_type = RZ in the Mesh block?
This multiplication to go from the bottom line to the blue area should be already performed by a SideIntegralPostprcoessor if you are using coord_type = RZ

No. I am not using RZ coord_type.
My simulated system is only a 2D green rectangular system.
Using results from the rectangular system, I can get 3D system results without 3D simulation when I can calculate

because my 2D system has cylindrical symmetry.

Well there's your problem.
If your 2D system has cylindrical symmetry, you have to specify the coordinate type of RZ in the Mesh block.
coord_type = RZ
If you dont, the postprocessing is wrong, but the solve as well. All the kernels are acting on elements of the wrong size.

Okay.
I will try the corrd_type = RZ.
Thank you very much!!

node.title: Function that Defines Diffusion Interior to a Domain
node.bodyText: Is there an example problem where in 2D a function is defined for a circle or any shape interior to a rectangular domains or similar,where the diffusion is defined by a function of the equation of a circle or any other shape, to be a constant value (by function not mesh shape) interior to the rectangular domain with source and sink boundary conditions defined to drive diffusion through the rectangular domain?

Hello
This seems pretty specific so I m going to say no.
If you want a circle mesh with a rectangle around you can use that:
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/meshgenerators/ConcentricCircleMeshGenerator.html
then stitch a few rectangular meshes around it with those
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/meshgenerators/CartesianMeshGenerator.html
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/meshgenerators/StitchedMeshGenerator.html
To define a function only in a circle, you can use a ParsedFunction with a simple if(x*x + y*y < r*r, this_function, 0)
With the mesh generators I pasted you can define different subdomains so you can block restrict source and sink
Guillaume

node.title: Clarification on `generate_core_metadata'
node.bodyText:
When using the reactor module, does it make sense to set generate_core_metadata = true if the core has only one level of patterning? The code is set to disallow generate_core_metadata = true with PatternedHexMeshGenerator object using PolygonConcentricCircleMeshGenerator objects as pattern inputs.
However, note that if using HexagonConcentricCircleAdaptiveBoundaryMeshGenerator instead of  PolygonConcentricCircleMeshGenerator (basically just replacing the type), core metadata can now be generated. Not sure if this working as intended, either.
@miaoyinb

HexagonConcentricCircleAdaptiveBoundaryMeshGenerator is used to generate a mesh that contains assembly-style metadata, which can be used by PatternedHexMeshGenerator as input unit assembly mesh for a core mesh (generate_core_metadata = true). HexagonConcentricCircleAdaptiveBoundaryMeshGenerator also provides the "adaptive boundary" feature, but you do not have to use it.
Mesh generated by PolygonConcentricCircleMeshGenerator only contains pin-style metadata, so it cannot be used as an input unit assembly mesh.

Thank you for the answer. However, I am still not sure if I need to generate core_metadata when my core is only singly-heterogeneous (i.e. only a lattice of pins, rather than a lattice of assemblies which themselves comprise of lattices of pins).
